medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive hypoesthesia, paresthesia, and weakness in the arms and legs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 18 months prior to admission with paresthesia in the feet, followed by recurrence of hypoesthesia and weakness in the feet 9 months before admission. Symptoms progressed to the legs and hands over several months, leading to multiple falls, necessitating the use of a cane and then a wheelchair.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic low-back pain treated with opioids, fibromyalgia, headaches, depression, history of lumbar surgery (laminectomy, facetectomies, foraminotomies), appendectomy, cholecystectomy, hysterectomy, and Roux-en-Y gastric bypass approximately 4 years prior.
medical_history.family_history: Father had a history of bladder cancer; no family history of autoimmune disease.
medical_history.social_history: Married, lives with husband in New England, does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
